text: TT algos give users the ability to improve their order execution by automating the placement of orders based on various criteria. With the TT bracket algo, traders can mitigate risk by placing an order and automating their exit strategy by the triggering of an OCO once the initial order is filled. The OCO consists of a limit order to realize a profit and a stop-loss order to limit the loss on the position. Let's use the TT bracket algo to enter a long position of 10e mini S&P futures we select tt bracket from the order type drop-down menu in MDTrader. We are going to set a profit target of 8 ticks to submit a limit order 8 ticks away from our initial fill. We will set a stop loss of 4 ticks to trigger a stop limit order 4 ticks through our fill price. We want our stop order to be entered at this trigger price so we are going to set pay up to zero. After setting our order quantity to 10, we will join the bid TT ALGOS submits an OCO order consisting of a limit order at 2156.25, eight ticks above our fill price, and a stop limit order at 2153.25, four ticks below our fill price. We see our limit order fill at 2156.25, exiting our position and meeting our profit target. The TT OCO parent order then automatically cancels the stop limit order. The TT Bracket ALGO makes it easy to automate an exit strategy following the execution of an order. TT Bracket ALGOs can be launched from an order ticket as well as MDTrader. Users can set a start time and an end time on the entire ALGO and can also have the ALGO triggered by price action. For more information on TT Bracket ALGOs, visit our website at TradingTechnologies.com.
